intro: [WRONG START] Embilia dasyantha, commonly known as the woolly embelia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. The fruit is a small, capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by animals.
